titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alva I. Cox Jr. Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Lucas L. Schulte and Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 2, 2019 at 22:03

did.unittitle: Alva I. Cox Jr. Papers
did.abstract: This collection documents the work of Alva I. Cox, Jr., an independent film maker whose work chronicled the civil rights movement, human rights struggles, and ecumenical Christianity both nationally and globally. The films, slides, pictures, audio cassettes, and paperwork of the Cox collection have been organized by topic. Of particular note are the materials related to Cox's film "Kent State: May 1970." The film, cuts, paperwork, and other materials regarding Kent State complement the notebooks of Peter Davies with whom Cox worked in the making of his Kent State film. The Davies notebooks are held in the Yale University Library Manuscripts and Archives Kent State Collection. Al Cox served for sixteen years as a staff member of the National Council of Churches in training and communications. After leaving the Council in 1967 to engage in freelance film work, he wrote more than thirty-five television scripts for the Columbia Broadcasting System (CBS). He also served as a communication consultant to various community organizations, labor unions, minority business enterprises, and church groups. Cox received an STM degree from Yale Divinity School in Contemporary Theology.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alva I. Cox Jr. Papers (RG 179), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

chronitem.event: Born in Mayfield, Ohio, the son of Helen R. (Roe) Cox and the Rev. Alva I. Cox
A.B. from Baldwin-Wallace College.
Attended the founding meeting of the World Council of Churches (WCC).
B.D. from Garrett Theological Seminary.
Pastor of Grace Methodist Church, Waterville, CT.
Ordained to Methodist Ministry.
Assoc. Director of Educational Evangelism of the National Council of Churches (NCC).
S.T.M. from Yale University Divinity School.
Director of Educational Media of the NCC.
Edited the book, The Delinquent, The Hipster, and The Square, and Other Plays .
Edited the book, Christian Education in the Church Today.
"Mary's Day: Immaculate Heart College" is produced.
Vice-president of Communication Trends, Inc., Cos Cob, CT.
Protestant consultant to CBS's "Look Up and Live" series.
Free-lance writer for CBS News.
Founder and president of Synesthetics, Inc., Washington, D.C.
"Kent State: May 1970" is produced.
Consultancy examining racism in the media, National Council of La Raza, Wash., D.C.
"Echoes of the Revolution" is produced.
Consultancy examining long-term effects of school desegregation, Baldwin Wallace College.
"To Belong Again" is produced.
"It Takes All Kinds" is produced.
"The Next Step" is produced.
"The Challenge of Change" is produced.
"Images of an Agenda" is produced.
"CWS Africa Emergency" is produced.
"The Frontier is the Spirit" is produced.
"Response / New World Outlook" is produced.
"Making the Dream Come True: Project Equality" is produced.
"Jubilee Advent: A Report" is produced.
"De Mujer A Mujer del Lebdo de Recursos" is produced.
"Rejoice, Again I Say Rejoice" is produced.
"Share the Struggle, Share the Joy" is produced.
"Rural Crisis: A Call for Justice and Action" is produced.
"Armenia Earthquake Appeal" is produced.
"Advocates for Justice" is produced.
"Innocent Until Proven Guilty: the Ecumenical Minority Bail Bond Fund" is produced.
"A Legacy to Share: From Governing Board to General Board" is produced.
"Pilgrimage for Peace" is produced.
"Crossroads for Mission" is produced.
"Unity and Reconciliation" is produced.
"Come Holy Spirit / Hope and Challenge" is produced.
Co-author with John B. Lindner of book and film "By Faith: Christian Students Among the Cloud of Witnesses".
"The Hope of Your Calling" is produced.
"NRSV: A Standard for Our Time" is produced.
"The Eighth Fire" is produced.
"Seeking the Common Good: A Challenge to Church and Synagogues" is produced.
"Waiting Upon the Lord--Transformation" is produced.
"The Unity of the Church--Faith and Order and the Healing of Life" is produced.
"Project Equality 30th Anniversary" is produced.
"Confirming a Heritage: Embracing the Future" is produced.
"The Churches Are Burning" is produced.
"To Do Justice: United Methodist Women" is produced.
Attended the WCC's 50th Anniversary Assembly, Harare, Zimbabwe.
"Orthodox and Wesleyan Spirituality" is produced.
"Burned in Hate--Rebuilt in Love" is produced.
Provided audio-visual technical support for the NCC's 50th Anniversary celebrations.
Alva Cox, Jr., died at his home in Cos Cob, CT, of natural causes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following excerpts from the National of Council of Churches obituary notice for Cox give a glimpse of his prominent role as a film maker:

...Colleagues spoke of Cox's important "behind the scenes" roles of building connections among major media, churches and justice movements and of telling the story of those movements....As Protestant consultant to CBS-TV's Sunday morning "Look Up and Live" series from 1967-76, Cox "was the best bridge for CBS to the civil rights movement, and he was the one who established our credibility with civil rights leaders," said Pamela Ilott, former CBS-TV vice president for cultural and religious broadcasting, now retired. "I don't think people know the debt they owe to Al Cox for being such a vital link between religious faith, social consciousness, and the creation of public awareness about the truth of racism. Andrew Young, in his memoirs, cited Al Cox of CBS as the key to creating a relationship with the network."... Ilott continued, "Al was ahead of so much of the then current church thinking of the 50's and 60's. He was willing to try out new ideas and to take risks. He was a real ally for me. Those many decades ago, I think he represented the very best of the younger church movement of the churches in civil rights and reconciliation. And his later work simply confirmed that. This shouldn't be forgotten.... Contacted with word of Cox's death, Ambassador Young whose long association with Cox included service together with Cox on the staff of the National Council of Churches in the 1950s said of him, "Countless Americans unknowingly have viewed the civil rights movement through the eyes of Al Cox. Al early identified the Gospel's demands within the Movement, stayed with it when the going got rough and subsequently interpreted its meaning to two more generations."

Series I of the Alva I. Cox Papers is a "catch-all" category of church related media. Included are materials on a wide range of topics, including: an audio interview about a new missionary congregation in Albuquerque, a film about the NRSV Bible, filmstrips about the liturgical year, footage from a conference on preaching, a film on the history of the Christian student movement, episodes of CBS's "Look Up and Live" series, a film about a college festival called Mary's Day which celebrates women, a Presbyterian television magazine about equal employment opportunity and an inclusive language lectionary, footage of a Russian Orthodox service, audio interviews about youth ministry and a student missionary trip to Haiti, footage of a student Christian conference called "Celebrate!", audio recordings of a conference about the relationship between Oklahoma's farm crisis and the rise of radical groups such as the Ku Klux Klan and neo-Nazis, a program about ministers fighting on behalf of unemployed steelworkers, films and audio tapes about the Episcopal Church, films about the Presiding Bishop's Fund for World Relief, audio tapes about refugees coming to the United States, a film about a fund providing money for minorities facing large amounts of bail, and a film about an interfaith coalition of Protestants, Catholics, and Jews to affect economic policies.

Series II focuses on the National Council of the Churches of Christ in the U.S.A. (NCC). This series includes such items as a CBS news program about controversy surrounding the NCC, footage of Arie Brouwer's NCC presidential acceptance speech, a film about various programs of the NCC, a film about the Interchurch Center (a.k.a. "475") in New York City, a film about the NCC's ecumenical approach to social justice issues, footage of a worship service by Billy Graham with the NCC, footage of NCC installation services for Rev. Joan Campbell and Dr. Syngman Rhee, footage of an NCC conference dealing with the church burnings of the 1990's, footage of the NCC's New World Order Project, a film about the NCC's Delta Ministry in Mississippi, an audio tape discussing the NCC's involvement in child advocacy and helping low-income families such as migrant workers in Nebraska, a film about the NCC Substance Abuse Consultation, and footage of a conference on racism.

Series III includes materials pertaining to both the NCC and the World Council of Churches (WCC). This series contains a CBS television special about how the funds of the NCC and WCC are used, a film on the NCC's and the WCC's efforts at unity and reconciliation, footage from the NCC and the WCC visiting the Pope at the Vatican, a film about the NCC and the WCC being involved in social justice issues, and footage of excerpts from the NCC-WCC press conference on "Racism is a Violation of Human Rights."

Series IV focuses specifically on the WCC. This series includes footage of WCC celebrations, a film showing a brief history of the WCC followed by a look into the processes of an activities at a WCC assembly in Australia, and another film about the WCC conference in Australia.

Series V focuses on Church World Services (CWS). It includes a film about what CWS does, footage of the 40th anniversary celebration of CWS, a program about the aid provided by CWS for the victims of an Armenia earthquake, a film about CWS providing aid to Ethiopia, Senegal, and Somalia, a program about an African medical center run by CWS to help malnourished children, a program about CWS's efforts to provide help for an African drought, and a couple of commercials by CWS appealing for donations for Somalia and the African drought.

Series VI contains materials related to the United Methodist Church (UMC). This category includes a film about the UMC's ministry in Alaska as well as footage of interviews and native dances used in this film, an audio recording of Rev. Glen "Tex" Evans speaking about the privilege of being a pastor, an audio recording of a meeting about how the UMC can help Native Alaskans and farmers, an audio recording about the Methodist theological tradition as well as the actions and organization of each continent's consultation, a film about the Gulfside facility given to the UMC by African-American Methodists as a retreat setting, a film with Bishop Forrest Stith about the New York Annual Conference of the UMC, a video from a consultation of Eastern Orthodox and Methodist churches, a film about a magazine for UMC women called Response , footage about the UMC in Africa, a film about a UMC program that brings individuals from South Africa to the U.S. as students and later returns them to South Africa to help educate others, a film to promote the expansion of UMC programs in New Jersey, a film about the UMC creating "shalom zones" and the Holy Boldness Program as responses to the L.A. riots of the 1990's, a film consisting of stories of faith and praise within the East Ohio Conference of the UMC, and a film about the involvement of UMC women in issues of social justice.

Series VII focuses on church burnings. This category contains a film about the burning of the New Hope Baptist Church in Seattle during the mid-1990's as well as its rebuilding, a film about the burnings of several African-American churches in the 1990's as well as the response of the NCC, footage of church leaders and civil rights leaders who are testifying to Congress about the mid-1990's church burnings, footage of an interview with Rev. Willy Coleman about his church being burned down in 1996, footage of the remains of a burned church from the mid-1990's, footage from NBC of Martin Luther King, Jr., examining burned churches as well as NBC news programs about the church burnings of the mid-1990's, a teen news program containing a segment about a volunteer helping rebuild burned churches (this program also features stories on President Clinton's summit on volunteerism and a militia standoff in Texas after the Waco incident), a film about the rebuilding of St. Mark's church after the church burnings of the 1990's, and footage of the rebuilding of a church.

Series VIII contains footage at Yale University Divinity School of a trio singing and Rev. James Forbes giving the Beecher Lecture in Marquand Chapel. Also included in this category is paperwork for a proposed film about nursing, which would have focused on the Yale School of Nursing.

Series IX focuses on issues of social awareness and social justice. This category includes a film demonstrating how everyday life in America is prejudiced in its privileging of Caucasians, a film about programs that can assist victims of crime with consequences that neither the justice system nor insurance companies may fully realize, an audio recording of an interview about the Good Samaritan Agency, a television program about economic empowerment of African-Americans in Seattle, a film about Project Equality, a film demonstrating some of the missed opportunities by schools, the juvenile justice system and communities at large to help troubled teens, footage of interviews about environmental problems in Albuquerque, a film about a legal brothel in Nevada, a video musical thank-you from the South for the help received during a drought, a couple of films made in response to the Land Claim Settlement Act in Alaska as well as a filmstrip/cassette package, a film made for the U.S.A.'s bicentennial that asks ordinary people whether or not freedom and justice are realities in their lives and the life of America, a film and audio interviews about present-day Native American Issues, a film about economic crisis faced by farmers, a filmstrip about toxic waste, footage of a flood in Bangladesh, a film about violence in South Africa and Mozambique, various photographs of Asia and misc. photos, an audio recording of interviews about Africa, and a film about police intimidation and peaceful protest in South Africa.

Series XI contains materials focusing on particular individuals. Included in this category are a photograph, biography, obituary, and funeral program of Al Cox, Jr.; footage of Dr. Wesley Ariarajah speaking about the future of evangelism from an ecumenical perspective; an audio recording from the memorial service for Rev. Malcolm Blackburn, who was an Episcopal priest and also a leader of the ecumenical movement; a television program interviewing Dr. Eugene C. Blake, former president of the NCC, about the ecumenical movement; a video tribute to Dr. Kenyan C. Burke; an audio recording of an interview with Baptist minister Will Campbell in Mississippi who is accepting of Ku Klux Klan members but not their views; a film about former president Jimmy Carter challenging the U.N.'s policy of non-interference with civil/internal strife of countries; an audio recording of an interview with UCC minister Ivan Delk, who is the national chairperson for Project Equality; footage of an interview with Tom Fassett of the UMC in Alaska; footage from a dinner honoring Archbishop Iakovos and his efforts in ecumenism; footage from an interview with a lawyer from Nigeria named Bola Iga who helped coordinate the college student movement; footage of a speech by Dr. Ron Meyers on health justice issues, an interview with theologian Mercy Odyoye about the coming of the year 2000 and Christianity in Africa, footage of Dalee Sambo speaking about issues of recognition of tribal governments in Alaska by the state and federal governments, and a CBS television special about Rev. Andrew Young, U.S. representative to the U.N.

Series XII contains miscellaneous materials, such as a sample reel of films made by Synesthetics, Inc., slide carousels of bioenergetic group therapy and bioenergetic analysis, a box of slides with a basic guide that show the harmful effects industries can have on the environment, a film focusing on the work of the Klingberg Family Centers, a film, audio interviews, and a slide carousel about the YWCA, footage of a UMC Swaziland choir, an audio recording of a film about jazz, artistic films about love and work, footage of Native Alaskan dancers, a slide carousel of Israel, and a film about Buddhism in Burma.

Series XIII contains the film and materials about the Kent State shootings of May 190. Included in this collection are the film narrated by E.G. Marshall that recreates the events at Kent State University leading up to the shootings of students by the Ohio National Guard, two user guides for the film, original TRK and PIX rolls for the film, audio reels for the film, slides of the photographs used, paperwork describing the camera shots, narrations script read by E.G. Marshall, a fact sheet, newspaper articles, a proposal for an one-hour television special about Kent State, correspondence, petitions for a federal grand jury, the "Prelude to Murder" document, Congressional record materials and responses to Congress' findings, newspaper articles about Attorney General John Mitchell closing the case, an artist's article about "The Truth About Kent State", rental receipts of the movie, the Kent State Alumni Publication from one month after the shootings, "An Appeal for Justice" document, a collection of poems by Kent State locals, letters regarding the 1972 Miami Beach Coallition, a response to John Mitchell, articles on the Grand Jury, articles on Peter Davies' donation of his Kent State findings to Yale, reviews of Davies' book, appeals to the Sixth Circuit U.S. Court of Appeals and to the U.S. Supreme Court, contracts for use of the film, an expense report, and paperwork from the making of the film such as a hand-edited script and Cox's personal notes.

list.item: II. National Council of the Churches of Christ in the U.S.A. (NCC)

Kent State Shootings, Kent, Ohio, 1970
controlaccess.corpname: National Council of the Churches of Christ in the United States of America

did.unittitle: Church-Related (General)
About the Church
"Virginia Brown--Albuquerque"; An interview about a new missionary congregation in Albuquerque. (audio cassette)

"Greek Orthodox"; video footage of misc. photographs including Orthodox priests, Archbishop Iakovos with several different U.S.A. presidents, and Orthodox services. (VHS / VTC: 2 volumes:Tape #12 and Tape #13)
"Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Aria da Capo" (VHS: two copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program contains a performance of Edna St. Vincent Millay's play, "Aria da Capo." This anti-war play combines comedy and pessimism, and at the end the host of "Look Up and Live" compares and contrasts this with the tragedy and optimism of Christianity.

did.unittitle: "Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Aria da Capo" (16mm film)
"Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Bad Boll, Germany--Beyond the Sanctuary" (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program is about an evangelical academy set up in Germany after World War II to address some of the changes in the church from the pre-war rural communities in which pastors knew all their parishoners, to post-war, industrial communities where urbanization and mobility have made people strangers. At this evangelical academy, business leaders come to discuss issues such as involvement of faith in work, diversity of faith in the workplace, and issues of mobility and urbanization. Students also come there to discuss starting out their new lives as adults, such as issues concerning marriage and finding a home. The evangelical academy also provides a format of informal discussion where employees can discuss and debate as equals with their employers.

did.unittitle: "Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Bad Boll, Germany--Beyond the Sanctuary" (16 mm film)
"Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Burlington, Vermont--Beyond the Sanctuary" (VHS: 2 copies) (DVD)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program focuses on Christ Church, a Presbyterian church in Burlington, Vermont. This community discusses such issues as whether or not the material needs of the church are distracting from the true purpose of the church, how are people to be members of the body of Christ and what are their responsibilities as members, what is the mission of the church and how is it enacted, and how can the church be made relevant to the needs of the community.

did.unittitle: "Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Burlington, Vermont--Beyond the Sanctuary" (16mm film)
"Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Taize, France--Beyond the Sanctuary" (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program is about the creation of the Protestant monastary at Taize, where monks take the 3 vows of the Rule of Taize: Celibacy, community property, and obedience to the superior.

did.unittitle: "Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Taize, France--Beyond the Sanctuary" (16mm film)
"Look Up and Live" CBS program: "The Christian and the Institutions--Part IV: The Purification" (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This episode is about the "guardian angel" of a pastor comes to demonstrate to him his own hypocrisy with building a fancy new church and how he interacts with his parishoners and other people.

did.unittitle: "Look Up and Live" CBS program: "The Christian and the Institutions--Part IV: The Purification" (16mm film)
"Look Up and Live" CBS program: Armor of Light--Part I: On the Rocks" (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This episode is about a discussion taking place among the a modern-day teenage boy, his family and girlfriend, and the apostle Paul. Paul challenges them about the status quo of modern-day churches.

did.unittitle: "Look Up and Live" CBS program: "Armor of Light--Part I: On the Rocks" (16mm film)
"Mary's Day: Immaculate Heart College" (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mary's Day was the most important celebration on the campus of Immaculate Heart College in California (closed in 1980). This festival was about Mary, the mother of Jesus, and celebrated women and their role in doing God's work.

did.unittitle: "Mary's Day: Immaculate Heart College" (16 mm film)

"Video One--Program #125"; This is a Presbyterian television magazine. This particular program includes stories about Equal Employment Opportunity, Inclusive Language Lectionary, Those Who Wait, and Resurrection Celebration. (VHS: 2 copies)
"Video One--Program #125" (U-matic tape)
Liturgy

"All the Words in Webster's Aren't Enough..."; Filmstrips about Advent, Christmas-Epiphany, Lent, and Easter, with LP to accompany (LP: 1; filmstrips: 8 volumes; 2 copies of vol. 1-4, 1 copy of vol. 5-8
"Archdiocese Chapel--Icons" (Beta Master)
"Archdiocese Chapel--Icons" - "Dub Selects"; Raw footage excerpts from interviews about Icons, Tribute, and Unity Theme. (VHS)
"Lectionary Committee"; Translators discussing gender-inclusive language. (audio cassette)

"NRSV: A Standard for Our Time";This film is about the New Revised Standard Version Bible (NRSV). Developments within the past 40 years, such as recent changes in the English language as well as discoveries such as the Dead Sea Scrolls, necessitated a new standard translation: the NRSV. Final version (VHS 2 copies, one VTC)
"NRSV: A Standard for Our Time"; Raw footage used in the making of this film. (Beta: 5 volumes)
"NRSV: A Standard for Our Time"; Raw footage used in the making of this film (VHS)
"O For a Thousand Tongues to Sing"; Hymns sung by a choir. (audio cassette)
"Religion in the U.S.S.R."; Raw footage/selects from a Russion Orthodox Mass (VHS: 2 volumes)
"World Day of Prayer"; A 1-minute spot for television about World Day of Prayer. (VHS)
Church Youth
"African Youth and Students: The Impact of Christian Witness"; A Christian youth conference in Africa. (Beta)
"African Youth and Students: The Impact of Christian Witness" (VHS)
"By Faith: Christian Students Among the Cloud of Witnesses"; This is a history of the Christian Student Movement, such as the YMCA and the YWCA. (U-matic Master)
"By Faith: Christian Students Among the Cloud of Witnesses" (Beta and DVD)
"By Faith: Christian Students Among the Cloud of Witnesses" (VHS)
"By Faith 2" (D-2: 1 (Master)
"Karen Hartley"; Interview about youth ministry (audio cassette)
"David Lyons"; Interview about a student Missionary trip to Haiti. (audio cassette)
"Maury Bola Iga Open Forum"; Interview about the student movement reviving the church. (audio cassette)
Student Christian Conference "Celebrate!"; Raw footage from Student Christian Conference. (VHS: 23 volumes)
Student Christian Conference "Celebrate!"; Raw footage from Student Christian Conference (U-matic S: 40 volumes)
"A Challenge to Our Generation"; This is raw footage of a speech by David Rowe at "Celebrate!" (U-matic)
"Celebrate" -Student Christian Conference; Louisville; Opening Session
"Celebrate" -Student Christian Conference; Louisville; Opening Session #2
"Celebrate" - Student Christian Conference; Louisville; Opening Session #4
"Celebrate" - Student Christian Conference; Louisville; Opening Session #5
""Celebrate" - Student Christian Conference; Louisville; #10; Denominational Meeting; Anti-Racism workshop, Part 1
"Celebrate" - Student Christian Conference; Louisville; Anti-Racism workshop, Part 2
Church Conferences

"Oklahoma Conference"; Audio from a conference in Oklahoma. Many conditions (such as weather, economics, etc.) have created a farm crisis in Oklahoma and other states. This has created a ripe atmosphere for radical groups and radical thinking, such as the KKK and neo-Nazis. (audio cassettes: 4 volumes)

"Stewardship"; Raw footage from a conference focusing on how preaching makes a difference for stewardship. (some of these videos also are under the titles of "Fire and the Focus" and "Camera Master Reel"). (U-matic: 11 volumes)
The Church and Social Action
(Unlabeled black tape); A person speaks about evangelization, social action, liberation, and so forth in relation to Catholicism and South Americans (audio cassette)

"The Fighting Ministers"; This film is about ministers fighting on behalf of unemployed steelworkers. Often these ministers get into trouble with their own denominations because of their convictions and efforts. (VHS)
"Venture in Mission: The Episcopal Church, U.S.A." (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is about the Episcopal Church helping with a variety of societal issues, such as the Good Samaritan Center providing bi-lingual and bi-cultural education for preschoolers, the church helping push for low-income housing in predominantly African-American neighborhoods which have not been retaining their former populations, and providing a community and facilities for the elderly.

did.unittitle: "Venture in Mission: The Episcopal Church, U.S.A." (16mm: 2 copies)

Episcopal Audio Tapes; These interviews about the Episcopal Church most likely are material from the preliminary stages of making either "The Next Step" or "Venture in Mission." (audio cassette: 13 volumes)

"The Next Step"; This is an extension of the Venture in Mission program. The five basic functions of mission considered here are service, worship, evangelism, education, and pastoral care. Final Version (VHS: 2 copies)
"The Next Step"; . Final Version (16mm)
"The Next Step and Scenics"; slides from photographs taken in preparation of and for making the film. (box of slides)
"Yes, A Difference: the Presiding Bishop's Fund for World Relief" (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a film about the worldwide involvements of the Presiding Bishop's Fund for World Relief, a fund which was founded in 1940 to help those fleeing from Nazi Germany.

did.unittitle: "Yes, A Difference" ( 16mm)

"Hope for New Life"; A film for the Presiding Bishop's Fund for World Relief. This fund helps bring refugees to the U.S. and the local churches help them integrate into the community while also providing opportunities for refugees to share their culture with the community. (VHS)
"Hope for New Life" (16 mm: 2 copies)
"Refugee Tapes"; These tapes are about refugees coming to the U.S.A. (audio cassettes: 2 volumes)
N.F.N.; Raw footage from the Neighbor for Neighbor program. (VHS: 7 volumes)
Neighbor For Neighbor program #1
Neighbor For Neighbor program #2
Neighbor For Neighbor program #3
Neighbor For Neighbor program #4
Neighbor For Neighbor program #5
Neighbor For Neighbor program #8
Neighbor For Neighbor program #9
Neighbor For Neighbor program #10
Neighbor For Neighbor program #11
Neighbor For Neighbor program #12
Neighbor For Neighbor program #13
Neighbor For Neighbor program #14
"On the Other Side" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is about the USSR and the Church's struggle to survive and thrive in this Communistic country. Delegates were sent from the NCC to the USSR to address issues of religious freedom, human rights, etc.

did.unittitle: "On the Other Side" (U-matic SP)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is about the USSR and the Church's struggle to survive and thrive in this Communistic country. Delegates were sent from the NCC to the USSR to address issues of religious freedom, human rights, etc.

did.unittitle: "On the Other Side" (VHS)
"Pilgrimage for Peace"; Special report on religious leaders making a "pilgrimage for peace" to the Middle East from the United States during the Gulf War. (VHS: Volume 1)
"Pilgrimage for Peace"; Special report on religious leaders making a "pilgrimage for peace" to the Middle East from the United States during the Gulf War. (VHS: Volume 2)
"Teaching Project Build" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is about Project Build, which prepares young men (primarily from the inner city) for entry into the building and construction trade apprenticeships. The program also helps older men to become journeymen.

did.unittitle: "Teaching Project Build" (16 mm)
"To Bring Good News" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program is about the Church helping the hungry and homeless, helping with public policies for long-term solutions to these problems, chaplaincy for those suffering from AIDS, economic policies, etc.

did.unittitle: "To Bring Good News" (U-matic)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program is about the Church helping the hungry and homeless, helping with public policies for long-term solutions to these problems, chaplaincy for those suffering from AIDS, economic policies, etc.

did.unittitle: "Welcoming the Children" (VHS and Beta)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a program about child advocacy. It talks about the need to use church resources to help with the needs of children.

did.unittitle: Ecumenical Dialogue/Conferences
"Ecumenical Development Initiative"; Raw footage from an ecumenical conference following the previous night's honorary dinner for Archbishop Iakovos. (VHS: 12 volumes; 3 copies)
"Ecumenical Development Initiative" (Beta: 24 volumes)
"Ecumenical Ensemble Music Cut"; Raw footage of a choir singing. (U-matic)
"Ecumenical Ensemble Music Cut" (Audio cassette)
"Jubilee Advent: A Report"; Ecumenical and Interfaith activities for the Jubilee in Washington, D.C. (VHS)
"Jubilee Advent: A Report" Ecumenical and Interfaith activities for the Jubilee in Washington, D.C. (D-2)
"Seeking the Common Good: A Challenge to Church and Synagogues" Final version (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is about a conference of the National Council of Churches, U.S. Catholic Conference, and the Synagogue Council of America. It discusses social issues with which these groups have had a positive impact, and how they can work together in these areas.

did.unittitle: "Seeking the Common Good: A Challenge to Church and Synagogues" Final versionn (D-2 Composite Digital; Master)

Ecumenical Efforts in Society
"Advocates for Justice"; (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is about an interfaith coalition of Protestants, Catholics, and Jews to affect economic policies. Its three areas of focus are: 1) Domestic human needs and economic policy, 2) Food and agricultural policy, 3) International development policy.

"On Holy Ground--U.S. Russia Ecumenical Youth Work Camp" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is about young American Christian volunteers helping restore a 14th century Russian Orthodox monastery. This monastery, used as a prison and death camp for years by the KGB, had finally been returned to its rightful owners.

Social Awareness / Social Justice Issues
"We Mean to Stay: the Delta Ministry in Mississippi" (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film starts out by showing the poverty for African-Americans in Mississippi. Racism is a major barrier to changing this condition. However, local African-American churches invite the NCC to come in and help implement changes, such as providing transportation for African-Americans to register to vote.

NCC and WCC
About NCC and WCC

"The Gospel According to Whom" (60 Minutes, CBS); This is a recording made from television. The segment deals with how funds of the NCC and WCC are being used. There are concerns about the NCC being "radically left," as well as accusations that the NCC is using funds to support Communism and Communistic propaganda. There are also accusations that funds from the WCC are being used to support guerrillas in Africa. (VHS)
"Unity and Reconciliation" (VHS: 2 copies one a VTC)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film focuses on the work of the NCC and WCC to unify and help with reconciliation. An example of efforts at reconciliation are in the "Pilgrimage for Peace," where Christian leaders from the U.S. travel to the Middle East on a mission of peace to try and end the Gulf War. Then the film shifts focus to unity within the church when Rev. Billy Graham speaks with the NCC. This focus on unity and reconciliation continues when the WCC visits the Aborigines of Australia. Finally, the film relates issues of feminism and feminist theology to unity and reconciliation, concluding with the installation of Rev. Joan Campbell as General Secretary of the NCC.

did.unittitle: "Unity and Reconciliation" (U-matic: 2 copies)

Church World Services (CWS)
About the CWS
"Share the Struggle, Share the Joy" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film celebrating the 40th anniversary of Church World Service is about receiving help from and giving help to farmers. U.S. farms provide CWS with food for countries in need. Later, as U.S. farms go through drought, CWS provides aid for them, too.

did.unittitle: "Share the Struggle, Share the Joy" (U-matic)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film celebrating the 40th anniversary of Church World Service is about receiving help from and giving help to farmers. U.S. farms provide CWS with food for countries in need. Later, as U.S. farms go through drought, CWS provides aid for them, too.

did.unittitle: "CWS 40th Anniversary"; Raw footage of the 40th anniversary of CWS. (Beta: 5 volumes)
The CWS in Action
"Armenia Earthquake Appeal" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program is about aid provided by CWS for the victims of the Armenia earthquake. It shows how the CWS works in this kind of disaster, such as by shipping medical supplies and blankets to Armenia.

did.unittitle: "CWS Africa Emergency"; This film is about aid provided by CWS to Ethiopia, Senegal, and Somalia. (VHS)
"Gewaha Medical Center"; This program is about an African medical center run by CWS, whose members help with undernourished and malnourished children. The program is short. (VHS)
"Signs of Change" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program is about help provided by CWS for the drought in Africa. CWS provided crop seeds, built water pumps for wells using local materials, and trained locals how to build and maintain their new water equipment.

did.unittitle: "Somalia Appeal--Africa Drought Appeal"; This 7-minute video consists of two commercials appealing for donations. The first shows CWS providing food in Somalia. The second shows water conservation and agricultural help provided by CWS. (VHS)

Programs and Activities
"Africa"; This is a rough draft of "Africa Church Growth and Development," which is about the UMC in Africa. (audio cassette)

"Sam Dhlamini--Catch the Spirit"; Sam Dhlamini is an artist and teacher in South Africa. The UMC in New Hampshire has a program that brings individuals like Sam from South Africa to the U.S. as students, and then returns them to South Africa to help educate others. Final version (VHS: 2 copies)
"Sam Dhlamini--Catch the Spirit" Final version (U-matic S SP Dubmaster)
"Sam Dhlamini--Catch the Spirit" Resource materials (U-matic S: 5 volumes)
"The Challenge of Change" Final version (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is aimed at promoting the expansion of programs within the United Methodist Church in New Jersey. As the population continues to increase in numbers and diversity, new and changing methods of ministry need to be implemented. Programs such as those aimed at teaching oneself and others about one's culture are an example of such new ministry presented by this "challenge of change."

did.unittitle: "The Challenge of Change" Final verson (16 mm)
"The Challenge of Change" Resource materials (U-matic S: 18 volumes)
"Holy Boldness / Shalom Convocation" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In response to the Los Angeles riots, the UMC created both "shalom zones" and the Holy Boldness Program. Together, these have seven goals: 1) Urban Theology, 2) Evangelism and congregational development, 3) Eradicating racism and other forms of oppression, 4) Strengthening multicultural relationships, 5) Community economic development, 6) Leadership development, 7) Wholeness, healing, and health.

did.unittitle: "Holy Boldness / Shalom Convocation" (Beta )

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In response to the Los Angeles riots, the UMC created both "shalom zones" and the Holy Boldness Program. Together, these have seven goals: 1) Urban Theology, 2) Evangelism and congregational development, 3) Eradicating racism and other forms of oppression, 4) Strengthening multicultural relationships, 5) Community economic development, 6) Leadership development, 7) Wholeness, healing, and health.

did.unittitle: "Rejoice, Again I Say Rejoice"; This film consists of stories of faith and praise within the East Ohio Conference of the United Methodist Church. These stories address the results and goals for financial resources within the conference. Final version (VHS)

"Rejoice, Again I Say Rejoice" Resource materials (U-matic S: 2 volumes - "East Ohio")
"To Do Justice: United Methodist Women" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film focuses on United Methodist women becoming involved in issues of social justice. The film first examines the history of Methodists and Methodist women being active in social justice issues, and then continues the examination with current activities of Methodist women.

did.unittitle: "To Do Justice: United Methodist Women" (VHS - 2nd copy)
Church Burnings
"Burned in Hate--Rebuilt in Love" (New Hope Baptist Church--Seattle, WA) (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program is about the burning of the New Hope Baptist Church in the mid-1990's. The official explanation of the cause of the fire is that it was an accident due to a faulty electrical box, but members of the congregation believe it was caused by people who had problems with the social activeness of this church, such as having reached an understanding with the Jewish community. However, members of the community help to rebuild this church.

did.unittitle: "Burned in Hate--Rebuilt in Love" (New Hope Baptist Church - Seattle, WA) (Betacam S Master)

Social Awareness / Social Justice
Societal Issues
"Beyond the News--Racism" (Beta)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This program demonstrates how everyday life is orientated and privileged for Caucasians, such as standards of beauty found in magazines.

did.unittitle: "Crime Victims: You Can Help" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film addresses the consequences faced by victims of crime that are not fully realized by the justice system, nor insurance companies. To help deal with these consequences, communities should create a crime victim witness assistance program. Such a program tries to assist in everything from physical, to mental, to emotional, to economic needs of victims.

did.unittitle: "Crime Victims: You Can Help" (U-matic)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film addresses the consequences faced by victims of crime that are not fully realized by the justice system, nor insurance companies. To help deal with these consequences, communities should create a crime victim witness assistance program. Such a program tries to assist in everything from physical, to mental, to emotional, to economic needs of victims.

"Inner City Entrepreneurial Training"; This is a program about economic empowerment of African-Americans in Seattle. (VHS Dub from TV)
"Inner City Entrepreneurial Training" (Beta Master)
"Making the Dream Come True: Project Equality"; This film is about Project Equality, a program that seeks equal rights and opportunities for women and minorities, especially in the workplace. (VHS)
"Making the Dream Come True: Project Equality" (U-matic)

"Project Equality 30th Anniversary"; This is the film of the conference to celebrate that 30 years ago the Catholic Church began Project Equality, which seeks better opportunities for minorities and women. Final version (VHS)

"See Jane Run" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is a 50 minute three-part film drama about a 13 year-old girl troubled by family problems and difficulties in school, who feels driven to run away from home and gradually falls into deeper trouble with the law. It is the story, too, of missed opportunities on the part of the school, the juvenile justice system and the community-at-large which because of a lack of viable alternatives and sensitive response, fail to meet the needs of Jane and her family.

did.unittitle: "See Jane Run" (16 mm: 2 copies)
"See Jane Run" (U-matic)
Issues in the U.S.A.
"Albuquerque: Rough Cut"; Raw footage of exterior shots and interviews about environmental problems in Albuquerque caused by plants which contaminate the water. (U-matic S)
"Chicken Ranch"; This film is about a legal brothel in Nevada. (VHS)
"Dixiana--'Spirit of the Land'" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a musical thank-you from the South for being helped out by other states during a drought: "...and to the farmers, truckers, and companies across America who have shared the 'Spirit of the Land' with our Southern farmers, God bless you..."

"Echoes of the Revolution" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film was produced for the Ecumenical Task Force on the Religious Observance of the Nation's Bicentennial and for the Department of Education for Mission of the National Council of Churches. Approximately 26 minutes long, it was filmed in a strip mining area in southeastern Ohio and in industrial sections of Cleveland. It features ordinary people in unscripted and unrehearsed conversation responding to the question of whether, two hundred years after the American Revolution, freedom and justice are realities in their lives and in the life of America.

did.unittitle: "Echoes of the Revolution" (16mm: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film was produced for the Ecumenical Task Force on the Religious Observance of the Nation's Bicentennial and for the Department of Education for Mission of the National Council of Churches. Approximately 26 minutes long, it was filmed in a strip mining area in southeastern Ohio and in industrial sections of Cleveland. It features ordinary people in unscripted and unrehearsed conversation responding to the question of whether, two hundred years after the American Revolution, freedom and justice are realities in their lives and in the life of America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film is about intimidation by police in South Africa against native Africans, such as the police imprisoning and abusing teenage boys, and about peaceful protest against the violence.

Spanish Films
"Abramos Nuestras Puertas ('We Open Our Doors')"; This film relates to alcoholism, drug addiction, and use of tobacco. (VHS)
"De Mujer A Mujer" (trans: "Woman to Woman") (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A planning committee of women from a local chapter of the UMC in San Antonio, TX, plan a program for the women in their church. The program is taken from the book Mujeres Forjando un Mundo ("Women Forging a World"). It centers on how women face change, and how they cope with it. The first part of the video is of the women in committee discussing and planning the program. The second half is the program itself.

did.unittitle: "De Mujer A Mujer del Libro de Recursos" (U-matic)
Individuals
"General Secretary's Mission Lecture Series: Dr. Wesley Ariarajah"; Dr. Ariarajah speaks about the future of mission evangelism from an ecumenical perspective. (VHS)
"Malcolm Blackburn memorial"; A tape from the memorial service for Rev. Malcolm Blackburn, an Episcopal priest who was a leader in the ecumenical movement. (audio cassette)

"Dr. Eugene C. Blake"; This program is part of an ABC Bicentennial celebration series called Directions: Conscience of America . This particular program is an interview about the ecumenical movement with Dr. Eugene C. Blake, former president of the NCC. The video is in black and white, and looks older than 1976, the year of the bicentennial. (Beta)
"Dr. Kenyon C. Burke--A Tribute" (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A tribute to Burke through video footage of him in action (such as his work in social justice issues), as well as interviews with him.

"To Belong Again"; This is a 17-minute film in color, produced during Klingberg Family Centers' 75th year. (VHS: 2 copies)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The film focuses on the Centers at work today, and also describes how the original "Children's Home" was begun by John Eric Klingberg, D.D. Various KFC alumni, including Barbara McCann, current Board of Trustee member, appear in the film.

"VEJEN"; This film is about Buddhism in Burma. (Carousel Films, Inc., produced by Elsebet Kjolbye) (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A narrator reads Buddhist teachings (in English) while a Buddhist monk is shown enacting these teachings within the community. A little boy accompanies the monk, and he then becomes the lead in a play telling about the story of the prince who became the Buddha. Every boy in Burma becomes the young prince once in his life. He must wear the robes of a Buddhist monk for at least the following week; but sometimes he chooses to wear it longer, whether it be for a month, a year, or perhaps for the rest of his life.

did.unittitle: "VEJEN" (16 mm)
Kent State
Kent State: May 1970 (final version) (VHS)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This film recreates the events at Kent State University leading up to the shootings in which members of the Ohio National Guard killed 4 students and injured 9 others. E.G. Marshall narrates a detailed chronology of the actions triggered by President Nixon's announcement of the invasion of Cambodia. The live action takes place in actual campus locations, but the film cuts to still photos taken by the many photographers to document each assertion. These photos help reconstruct the events accurately and to assess the various, contradictory interpretations of what happened that day.
